intro: Sphaerostephanos grandescens, commonly known as the large globular star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescence that resembles a star. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in a spherical cluster. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
